articles.title: How we’re responding to The New York Times’ data demands in order to protect user privacy
articles.description: OpenAI is fighting a court order at the demands of The New York Times and plaintiffs, which involves retention of consumer ChatGPT and API user data indefinitely. Learn how we’re working to uphold user privacy, address legal requirements, and stay true to our data protection commitments.

articles.title: Scaling security with responsible disclosure
articles.description: OpenAI introduces its Outbound Coordinated Disclosure Policy to guide how it responsibly reports vulnerabilities in third-party software—emphasizing integrity, collaboration, and proactive security at scale.

articles.title: Addendum to OpenAI o3 and o4-mini system card: OpenAI o3 Operator
articles.description: We are replacing the existing GPT-4o-based model for Operator with a version based on OpenAI o3. The API version will remain based on 4o.

articles.title: Disrupting malicious uses of AI: June 2025
articles.description: In our June 2025 update, we outline how we’re disrupting malicious uses of AI—through safety tools that detect and counter abuse, support democratic values, and promote responsible AI deployment for the benefit of all.

articles.title: Shipping code faster with o3, o4-mini, and GPT-4.1
articles.description: CodeRabbit uses OpenAI models to revolutionize code reviews—boosting accuracy, accelerating PR merges, and helping developers ship faster with fewer bugs and higher ROI.

articles.title: Creating websites in minutes with AI Website Builder
articles.description: Wix’s AI Website Builder, powered by OpenAI, lets anyone create a full website in minutes—just by describing their idea in a conversation.

articles.title: Introducing Stargate UAE
articles.description: We’re launching Stargate UAE – the first international deployment of Stargate, OpenAI’s AI infrastructure platform.

articles.title: New tools and features in the Responses API
articles.description: New features in the Responses API: Remote MCP, image gen, Code Interpreter, and more. Powering faster, smarter agents with GPT-4o & o-series models, plus new features for reliability and efficiency.

articles.title: OpenAI Deutschland
articles.description: OpenAI announces the opening of its first office in Germany, based in Munich.

articles.title: Addendum to o3 and o4-mini system card: Codex
articles.description: Codex is a cloud-based coding agent. Codex is powered by codex-1, a version of OpenAI o3 optimized for software engineering. codex-1 was trained using reinforcement learning on real-world coding tasks in a variety of environments to generate code that closely mirrors human style and PR preferences, adheres precisely to instructions, and iteratively runs tests until passing results are achieved.

articles.title: Introducing data residency in Asia
articles.description: Data residency builds on OpenAI’s enterprise-grade data privacy, security, and compliance programs supporting customers worldwide.

articles.title: The San Antonio Spurs use ChatGPT to scale impact on and off the court
articles.description: Discover how the San Antonio Spurs are using custom GPTs to enhance fan engagement, streamline operations, and drive innovation across teams.

articles.title: Lowe’s puts project expertise into every hand
articles.description: Lowe’s partnered with OpenAI to build Mylow and Mylow Companion, AI-powered tools that bring expert help to both customers and store associates—making complex home improvement projects easier to plan, navigate, and complete.

articles.title: Introducing HealthBench
articles.description: HealthBench is a new evaluation benchmark for AI in healthcare which evaluates models in realistic scenarios. Built with input from 250+ physicians, it aims to provide a shared standard for model performance and safety in health.

articles.title: OpenAI Expands Leadership with Fidji Simo
articles.description: Read the message Sam shared with the company earlier today.

articles.title: OpenAI’s response to the Department of Energy on AI infrastructure
articles.description: Why infrastructure is destiny and how the US can seize it.

articles.title: Introducing OpenAI for Countries
articles.description: A new initiative to support countries around the world that want to build on democratic AI rails.

articles.title: From Hot Wheels to handling content: How brands are using Microsoft AI to be more productive and imaginative
articles.description: The post From Hot Wheels to handling content: How brands are using Microsoft AI to be more productive and imaginative appeared first on The AI Blog.
articles.author: John Roach

articles.title: Introducing Codex
articles.description: Introducing Codex: a cloud-based software engineering agent that can work on many tasks in parallel, powered by codex-1. With Codex, developers can simultaneously deploy multiple agents to independently handle coding tasks such as writing features, answering questions about your codebase, fixing bugs, and proposing pull requests for review.

articles.title: Sam & Jony introduce io
articles.description: Building a family of AI products for everyone.

articles.title: AI powers Expedia’s marketing evolution
articles.description: A conversation with Jochen Koedijk, Chief Marketing Officer of Expedia Group.
